item.title: Toggle Button Option 2?
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:5, topic:276049”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=364591.msg2767281#msg2767281 date=1240886625]
Though you don’t really have to follow them, Java conventions specify that all methods and variables should start with a lowercase name. Variables are generally nouns and methods are generally verbs. Classes start with uppercase names and name an object.
[/quote]

I will start following that in future applications. I really am just getting used to making them. All I have really done so far is add a simple subtraction option to an addition tutorial.

GUIs interest me, so I will probably add onto this one until I create more. I jarred this for now, so I guess I will see what I do in the future.[/quote]
Please l2 GridLayout or something like that, makes it much more easier.

Read full topic

item.title: Toggle Button Option 2?

item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:9, topic:276049”]I have been searching around for quite awhile now, and I am still looking. If anyone can help me out here:

How do you open a web page through a GUI? Do I use the java.net package? Really all that seems like a decent guess would be this:

java.net.URL.

This would be greatly appreciated if you can help.[/quote]

java.awt.Desktop.getDesktop().browse(java.net.URI)

item.title: Toggle Button Option 2?
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Why don’t you subclass JButton and add a toggled property, so you can set the state from code, as well as user input, without having to rely the text of the button.

item.title: Toggle Button Option 2?
item.dc:creator: @Shiver Shiver
item.description:
@Shiver wrote:

private void OnorOffButtonActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) { OnorOffButton.setText(OnorOffButton.getText().equals("ON") ? "OFF" : "ON"); }

make sure default text is “ON” or “OFF”.

Also, you should rename the variable to “toggleButton” or something along those lines.

Read full topic

item.title: Toggle Button Option 2?
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Alright, I basically am attempting to create my first GUI. I am just messing around with the program right now. I have my toggle option for ON and OFF. It will only go to ON, so how do I make another method to switch it back to off?

Here is my code…

[code] private void OnorOffButtonActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {

    OnorOffButton.setText("ON");
    OptionText.setText("Yes");

}

private void ExitGUIActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {
    System.exit(0);

}

private void ClearButtonActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {
    OptionText.setText("");[/code]

I am using NetBeans. If you need any other information, please feel free to post.

Read full topic
